2018_9_24.Notes: slang for 'telefon' - 'telo' (commonly used, so remember it!)
2018_9_24.Sentence: Ma kasutan oma telefoni iga päev
2018_9_24.Translation: I use my phone every day

2018_10_12.Notes: Both a noun and an adjective

2018_10_14.Notes: Genitive is long /o:/, partitive and short illative is overlong /o::/
2018_10_14.English: Steering wheel; wheel (of a boat or ship)

2018_10_15.Sentence: Ei kannata sellise külmaga õue minna.
2018_10_15.Translation: It's too cold to go outside (lit. 'It is not tolerable to go outside with such a cold')

2018_10_16.Notes: Short illative and Partitive plural are uncommon.
2018_10_16.Translation: The traffic is pretty heavy here.

2018_10_17.Notes: Is a compound of maa + ilm, but has an unique pronunciation. Listen to native speakers pronouncing this word! If you hear it pronounced normally, with t
